medical_records.title: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Patient diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes. HbA1c level at 8.2%. Fasting glucose 180 mg/dL. Started on metformin 500mg twice daily. Diet and exercise counseling provided. Follow-up in 3 months for HbA1c recheck.

medical_records.title: Essential Hypertension
medical_records.content: Blood pressure consistently elevated at 150/95 mmHg over three visits. No signs of end-organ damage. Started on lisinopril 10mg daily. Target BP <140/90. Advised low sodium diet.

medical_records.title: Annual Lipid Panel
medical_records.content: Total cholesterol: 220 mg/dL, LDL: 145 mg/dL, HDL: 42 mg/dL, Triglycerides: 165 mg/dL. LDL above target for diabetic patient. Consider statin therapy if lifestyle modifications insufficient.

medical_records.title: Diabetes Follow-up
medical_records.content: HbA1c improved to 7.4%. Patient reports good medication compliance. Occasional hypoglycemic episodes in morning. Adjusted metformin timing to after meals. Continue current regimen.

medical_records.title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
medical_records.content: Patient presents with persistent worry, difficulty sleeping, and restlessness for past 6 months. GAD-7 score: 15 (moderate). Started on sertraline 50mg daily. Referred to therapist for CBT. Follow-up in 4 weeks.

medical_records.title: Anxiety Treatment Progress
medical_records.content: Patient reports 50% improvement in symptoms. Sleep quality improved. GAD-7 score down to 9. Increased sertraline to 100mg for optimal response. Continue therapy sessions.

medical_records.title: Migraine Without Aura
medical_records.content: Recurrent unilateral headaches with nausea, photophobia. 3-4 episodes per month. Prescribed sumatriptan 50mg PRN for acute attacks. Advised headache diary. Consider prophylaxis if frequency increases.

medical_records.title: Cardiac Catheterization and PCI
medical_records.content: Patient presented with STEMI. Emergency cardiac catheterization revealed 95% occlusion of LAD. Successful PCI with drug-eluting stent placement. EF 45% post-procedure. Started on dual antiplatelet therapy.

medical_records.title: Post-MI Cardiac Rehabilitation
medical_records.content: Enrolled in 12-week cardiac rehabilitation program. Target heart rate during exercise: 100-120 bpm. Dietary counseling for heart-healthy eating. Smoking cessation achieved.

medical_records.title: Cardiac Follow-up Labs
medical_records.content: LDL: 68 mg/dL (at goal), HDL: 48 mg/dL, BNP: 150 pg/mL. Liver function tests normal on statin therapy. Continue current medications.

medical_records.title: Annual Cardiology Review
medical_records.content: Echocardiogram shows EF improved to 50%. No anginal symptoms. Exercise tolerance good - walks 2 miles daily. Continue aspirin, clopidogrel (complete 1 year DAPT), atorvastatin 80mg, metoprolol 50mg BID.

medical_records.title: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis
medical_records.content: TSH elevated at 12.5 mIU/L, Free T4 low at 0.6 ng/dL. Positive TPO antibodies. Diagnosed with Hashimoto's thyroiditis. Started levothyroxine 50mcg daily. Recheck TSH in 6 weeks.

medical_records.title: Thyroid Function Follow-up
medical_records.content: TSH normalized at 2.8 mIU/L. Free T4: 1.1 ng/dL. Patient reports improved energy levels and resolution of constipation. Continue levothyroxine 50mcg.

medical_records.title: Vitamin D Deficiency
medical_records.content: 25-OH Vitamin D: 15 ng/mL (deficient). Started on vitamin D3 2000 IU daily. Advised sun exposure 15-20 minutes daily. Recheck in 3 months.

medical_records.title: Upper GI Endoscopy
medical_records.content: EGD performed for epigastric pain and dyspepsia. Findings: 1.5cm gastric ulcer in antrum, no active bleeding. Biopsy taken - negative for malignancy, positive for H. pylori. CLO test positive.

medical_records.title: H. pylori Treatment
medical_records.content: Started triple therapy: pantoprazole 40mg BID, amoxicillin 1g BID, clarithromycin 500mg BID for 14 days. Patient allergic to aspirin/NSAIDs - avoid these medications. Follow-up EGD in 8 weeks.

medical_records.title: Post-Treatment Follow-up
medical_records.content: Repeat EGD shows healed ulcer. H. pylori breath test negative - eradication successful. Continue PPI for 4 more weeks then reassess. Avoid NSAIDs permanently due to allergy and ulcer history.

medical_records.title: First Prenatal Visit
medical_records.content: G2P1 at 8 weeks gestation. Previous uncomplicated vaginal delivery. Current pregnancy desired. Started prenatal vitamins and folic acid. First trimester screening scheduled. No concerning symptoms.

medical_records.title: First Trimester Labs
medical_records.content: Hemoglobin: 10.2 g/dL (mild anemia), Blood type O negative - RhoGAM will be needed. Rubella immune. HIV, Hepatitis B, Syphilis negative. Started iron supplementation 325mg daily.

medical_records.title: 20-Week Anatomy Scan
medical_records.content: Detailed ultrasound shows normal fetal anatomy. Placenta anterior, not previa. AFI normal. Fetal growth appropriate for gestational age. Continue routine prenatal care.

medical_records.title: Alzheimer's Disease Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Progressive memory decline over 2 years. MMSE score: 18/30. MRI shows hippocampal atrophy. Clinical diagnosis of probable Alzheimer's disease, moderate stage. Started donepezil 5mg daily.

medical_records.title: Alzheimer's Medication Adjustment
medical_records.content: Increased donepezil to 10mg daily after tolerating initial dose. Added memantine 5mg daily for combination therapy. Family educated on disease progression and safety measures.

medical_records.title: Comorbid Depression
medical_records.content: Patient showing signs of depression with apathy and decreased appetite. GDS score: 12/15. Started low-dose sertraline 25mg (caution with dementia). Monitor for worsening confusion.

medical_records.title: 6-Month Cognitive Assessment
medical_records.content: MMSE stable at 17/30. Mood improved with sertraline. Patient able to perform basic ADLs with supervision. Caregiver reports manageable behaviors. Continue current regimen.

medical_records.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Symmetrical polyarthritis affecting MCPs, PIPs, and wrists for 8 months. RF positive, Anti-CCP positive, ESR elevated. X-rays show early erosive changes. Diagnosed with seropositive RA. Started methotrexate 15mg weekly.

medical_records.title: Methotrexate Monitoring
medical_records.content: CBC normal, LFTs mildly elevated (ALT 52). Reducing methotrexate to 12.5mg weekly. Adding folic acid 1mg daily to reduce side effects. Recheck labs in 4 weeks.

medical_records.title: RA Disease Activity Assessment
medical_records.content: DAS28-ESR: 3.8 (moderate activity). Morning stiffness reduced to 30 minutes. Joint swelling improved. Continue methotrexate 12.5mg. PRN naproxen for flares. Consider biologic if inadequate response.

medical_records.title: Persistent Asthma Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Recurrent wheezing and shortness of breath since childhood. Spirometry shows FEV1 75% predicted with 15% improvement post-bronchodilator. Diagnosed with moderate persistent asthma. Started on ICS/LABA combination.

medical_records.title: Severe Peanut Allergy Documentation
medical_records.content: History of anaphylaxis to peanuts age 7. Carries epinephrine auto-injector at all times. Skin prick test strongly positive. Strict peanut avoidance advised. Updated allergy action plan provided.

medical_records.title: Asthma Control Assessment
medical_records.content: ACT score: 22/25 (well-controlled). No ER visits or oral steroid courses this year. Peak flow stable at 85% personal best. Continue current inhaler regimen. Annual flu vaccine given.

medical_records.title: Breast Cancer Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Stage IIA invasive ductal carcinoma, ER+/PR+/HER2-. 2.3cm tumor, 1/15 lymph nodes positive. Underwent lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy. Oncotype DX score: 18 (low risk).

medical_records.title: Adjuvant Treatment Completion
medical_records.content: Completed 4 cycles of TC chemotherapy and 6 weeks of radiation therapy. Started on tamoxifen 20mg daily for 5-year course. Tolerating well, minor hot flashes.

medical_records.title: DEXA Scan Results
medical_records.content: Lumbar spine T-score: -1.8 (osteopenia). Hip T-score: -1.5. Increased fracture risk due to tamoxifen. Started calcium 1200mg + vitamin D 2000 IU daily. Weight-bearing exercise advised.

medical_records.title: 2-Year Oncology Follow-up
medical_records.content: No evidence of recurrence. Mammogram and clinical exam normal. Continue tamoxifen for 3 more years. Managing side effects well. Next imaging in 6 months.

medical_records.title: Kidney Stone Episode
medical_records.content: Presented with acute left flank pain and hematuria. CT KUB showed 6mm stone in left ureterovesical junction. Managed conservatively with hydration and pain control. Stone passed spontaneously after 3 days.

medical_records.title: 24-Hour Urine Analysis
medical_records.content: Stone composition: calcium oxalate. 24-hour urine shows hypercalciuria and low citrate. Advised increased fluid intake (2.5L/day), low sodium diet, and citrate supplementation.

medical_records.title: Gout Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Acute painful swelling of right first MTP joint. Serum uric acid: 9.2 mg/dL. Joint aspirate shows negatively birefringent crystals. Treated acute flare with colchicine. Lifestyle modifications advised.

medical_records.title: Ulcerative Colitis Diagnosis
medical_records.content: 6-month history of bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramps. Colonoscopy shows continuous inflammation from rectum to splenic flexure (left-sided UC). Biopsies confirm ulcerative colitis. Started mesalamine 4.8g daily.

medical_records.title: UC Remission Assessment
medical_records.content: Patient in clinical remission - no bloody stools for 4 months. Fecal calprotectin: 85 (near normal). Continue mesalamine maintenance therapy. Screening colonoscopy due in 8 years.

medical_records.title: Annual UC Labs
medical_records.content: CBC normal (no anemia). CRP: 0.3 mg/L (normal). LFTs normal. Vitamin D: 28 ng/mL (sufficient). Iron studies normal. Disease well-controlled on current therapy.

medical_records.title: Type 1 Diabetes - Long-standing
medical_records.content: Patient with T1DM since age 12. Currently on basal-bolus insulin regimen: glargine 25 units at bedtime, lispro with meals per carb counting. Recent HbA1c: 7.8%.

medical_records.title: Diabetic Nephropathy Stage 3
medical_records.content: Urine albumin-creatinine ratio persistently elevated at 180 mg/g. eGFR: 45 mL/min (CKD stage 3b). Started ACE inhibitor for renal protection. BP target <130/80.

medical_records.title: Nephrology Consultation
medical_records.content: Diabetic nephropathy progressing slowly. eGFR stable at 42. Proteinuria improved to 150 mg/g on ACE inhibitor. Avoid NSAIDs and contrast dye. Consider nephrology referral if eGFR <30.

medical_records.title: Major Depressive Disorder
medical_records.content: Patient reports persistent low mood, anhedonia, poor concentration, and passive suicidal ideation for 3 months. PHQ-9 score: 19 (moderately severe). No active suicidal plan. Started escitalopram 10mg daily.

medical_records.title: Depression Follow-up
medical_records.content: PHQ-9 improved to 12 at 6 weeks. Increased escitalopram to 20mg. Patient reports initial insomnia - added trazodone 50mg at bedtime. Continues therapy sessions weekly.

medical_records.title: 6-Month Mental Health Review
medical_records.content: Significant improvement in mood. PHQ-9: 6 (mild). Sleeping well on trazodone. Suicidal ideation resolved. Continue current medications. Reduce therapy to biweekly.

medical_records.title: Parkinson's Disease Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Progressive resting tremor, bradykinesia, and rigidity over 2 years. No red flags for atypical parkinsonism. Started carbidopa-levodopa 25/100 TID with good initial response.

medical_records.title: Motor Fluctuations Management
medical_records.content: Patient experiencing wearing-off phenomenon. Added pramipexole 0.5mg TID. Adjusted levodopa to 5 doses per day. Motor symptoms improved with longer 'on' time.

medical_records.title: Parkinson's Disease Dementia
medical_records.content: Cognitive decline noted 5 years after motor symptoms. MoCA score: 18/30. Visual hallucinations present (non-threatening). Started rivastigmine patch 4.6mg daily. Caregiver support arranged.

medical_records.title: Chronic Migraine Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Headache on 18 days per month, 10 meeting migraine criteria. Using OTC analgesics daily. Diagnosed with chronic migraine and medication overuse headache. Started topiramate prophylaxis and analgesic taper.

medical_records.title: Migraine Prevention Follow-up
medical_records.content: After 3 months on topiramate 100mg daily and stopping daily analgesics, headache days reduced to 8 per month. Using sumatriptan only 2-3 times per month. Significant improvement in function.

medical_records.title: Headache Diary Review
medical_records.content: Migraine days now 6 per month (episodic). Identified triggers: stress, irregular sleep, red wine. Continue topiramate 100mg. Lifestyle modifications reinforced. Consider CGRP inhibitor if worsens.

medical_records.title: Sleep Apnea Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Severe snoring, witnessed apneas, excessive daytime sleepiness. Epworth Sleepiness Scale: 15. Polysomnography shows AHI 32 (moderate-severe OSA). CPAP therapy initiated at 10 cm H2O.

medical_records.title: CPAP Compliance Review
medical_records.content: CPAP data shows average use 6.2 hours/night with AHI 2.3 (well controlled). Patient reports improved energy and alertness. Blood pressure also improved with OSA treatment.

medical_records.title: Cardiovascular Risk Labs
medical_records.content: Total cholesterol: 210, LDL: 130, HDL: 45, TG: 175. BP on treatment: 128/82. Started rosuvastatin 10mg for primary prevention given multiple risk factors.

medical_records.title: Heart Failure Diagnosis
medical_records.content: Progressive dyspnea on exertion and lower extremity edema. BNP: 450. Echocardiogram shows EF 55% (preserved), Grade 2 diastolic dysfunction. Diagnosed with HFpEF. Started on empagliflozin for dual benefit.

medical_records.title: Heart Failure Optimization
medical_records.content: Symptoms improved on empagliflozin - less dyspnea and edema. BNP down to 280. Continue SGLT2 inhibitor. Salt restriction reinforced. Target weight maintenance.

medical_records.title: Diabetes and Renal Monitoring
medical_records.content: HbA1c: 7.2% (improved from 8.1%). eGFR: 65 (stable). UACR: 45 mg/g (microalbuminuria improved). Continue metformin and empagliflozin. Losartan providing renal protection.

medical_records.title: Chronic Low Back Pain
medical_records.content: Persistent lumbar pain for 3 years, worse with prolonged sitting. MRI shows L4-L5 disc bulge without nerve compression. No red flags. Conservative management with physical therapy and gabapentin.

medical_records.title: Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
medical_records.content: Burning and tingling in feet bilaterally. Monofilament test abnormal. HbA1c 8.5% (suboptimal control). Added duloxetine 60mg for neuropathic pain. Emphasized glycemic control.

medical_records.title: Pain Management Follow-up
medical_records.content: Pain scores improved from 7/10 to 4/10 on combination therapy. Sleeping better. Continue gabapentin 300mg TID and duloxetine 60mg daily. Physical therapy ongoing.

medical_records.title: Osteoporosis with Vertebral Fracture
medical_records.content: Back pain led to discovery of T12 compression fracture on X-ray. DEXA scan: lumbar T-score -3.2, hip -2.8 (osteoporosis). Started alendronate 70mg weekly with calcium and vitamin D.

medical_records.title: Osteoporosis Treatment Review
medical_records.content: On bisphosphonate for 18 months. No new fractures. Taking medication correctly (fasting, upright 30 min). Minor GI upset - added PPI. Repeat DEXA scheduled.

medical_records.title: Bone Health Labs
medical_records.content: Calcium: 9.2 (normal), Vitamin D: 38 (sufficient), PTH: 45 (normal). 24-hour urine calcium normal. Continue current supplementation. DEXA shows 3% improvement in lumbar spine BMD.
